definitions: To connect (an electrical device) to the earth as a return path for electric current, or to ground it.
To bury (a dead body) in the earth.
To dig up or unearth (an animal, especially a badger or fox) from its burrow.
examples: Always earth the appliance before use.
They will earth the potatoes to protect them from frost.
The dog tried to earth the rabbit.
The body was earthed in the old cemetery.
